3260.verse: فَٱلْتَقَطَهُۥٓ|Then picked him up|148|164|13335$ءَالُ|(the) family|97|129|2198$فِرْعَوْنَ|(of) Firaun|93|125|2649$لِيَكُونَ|so that he might become|186|218|12206$لَهُمْ|to them|72|88|98$عَدُوًّا|an enemy|84|92|914$وَحَزَنًا‌ۗ|and a grief.|96|113|13336$إِنَّ|Indeed,|70|87|58$فِرْعَوْنَ|Firaun|93|110|2649$وَهَـٰمَـٰنَ|and Haman|93|110|13326$وَجُنُودَهُمَا|and their hosts|120|137|13327$كَانُواْ|were|69|77|94$خَـٰطِــِٔينَ|sinners.|95|95|9269$

3264.verse: ۞ وَحَرَّمْنَا|And We had forbidden|166|178|13351$عَلَيْهِ|for him|65|88|395$ٱلْمَرَاضِعَ|the wet nurses|120|143|13352$مِن قَبْلُ|before,|92|115|250$فَقَالَتْ|so she said,|99|122|13353$هَلْ|"Shall I|66|78|1829$أَدُلُّكُمْ|direct you|87|94|11428$عَلَىٰٓ|to|63|77|52$أَهْلِ|(the) people|102|116|2993$بَيْتٍ|(of) a house|102|116|3102$يَكْفُلُونَهُۥ|who will rear him|130|144|13354$لَكُمْ|for you|67|81|207$وَهُمْ|while they|88|95|256$لَهُۥ|to him|61|300|977$نَـٰصِحُونَ|(will be) sincere?"|137|376|13355$

3265.verse: فَرَدَدْنَـٰهُ|So We restored him|150|157|13356$إِلَىٰٓ|to|53|67|118$أُمِّهِۦ|his mother|89|103|13357$كَىْ|that|52|66|11405$تَقَرَّ|might be comforted|149|163|11431$عَيْنُهَا|her eye,|75|89|11432$وَلَا|and not|71|78|25$تَحْزَنَ|she may grieve|120|137|11433$وَلِتَعْلَمَ|and that she would know,|192|226|13358$أَنَّ|that|48|82|240$وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ|the Promise of Allah|151|185|8195$حَقٌّ|(is) true.|79|96|3076$وَلَـٰكِنَّ|But|78|132|952$أَكْثَرَهُمْ|most of them|108|215|5560$لَا|(do) not|75|182|30$يَعْلَمُونَ|know.|92|146|115$

3258.verse: And establish them in the land and show Pharaoh and [his minister] Haman and their soldiers through them that which they had feared.

3259.verse: And We inspired to the mother of Moses, "Suckle him; but when you fear for him, cast him into the river and do not fear and do not grieve. Indeed, We will return him to you and will make him [one] of the messengers."

3260.verse: And the family of Pharaoh picked him up [out of the river] so that he would become to them an enemy and a [cause of] grief. Indeed, Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers were deliberate sinners.

3261.verse: And the wife of Pharaoh said, "[He will be] a comfort of the eye for me and for you. Do not kill him; perhaps he may benefit us, or we may adopt him as a son." And they perceived not.

3262.verse: And the heart of Moses' mother became empty [of all else]. She was about to disclose [the matter concerning] him had We not bound fast her heart that she would be of the believers.

3263.verse: And she said to his sister, "Follow him"; so she watched him from a distance while they perceived not.

3264.verse: And We had prevented from him [all] wet nurses before, so she said, "Shall I direct you to a household that will be responsible for him for you while they are to him [for his upbringing] sincere?"

3265.verse: So We restored him to his mother that she might be content and not grieve and that she would know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of the people do not know.
